title._content: [The Touchstone Garden, 118-120 East 30th Street, New York, New York. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. [The Touchstone Garden, 118-120 East 30th Street, New York, New York. Pathway] [1919 Summer] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House architecture: George E. Fowler, architect for The Touchstone magazine. Landscape: Eloise Roorbach, garden editor of The Touchstone magazine. Hartmann-Sanders supplied the arbor. Other: This was the garden of the townhouse offices of The Touchstone magazine. Today: Houses, but not garden, extant. On slide (handwritten): "T." Also, blue star sticker. On slide (printed), obscured by blank label: "[...] York." (Slide manufactured by: T.H. McAllister-Keller Co., 176 Fulton St., New York) Slide for lecturing on city and suburban gardens. Title and date information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16658 Call Number: LC-J717-X107- 14
